summary: Avengers: Endgame tendría una duración de 3 horas y 2 minutos
title: Avengers: Endgame tendría una duración de 3 horas y 2 minutos
body:
Avengers: Endgame tendría una duración de 3 horas y 2 minutos

AMC Theatres podría haber dejado caer accidentalmente el tiempo de duración de la próxima película de Marvel Studios.

En la página de inicio de AMC Theatres para Avengers: Endgame, el tiempo total de duración de la próxima película aparece como 3 horas y 2 minutos.

Este runtime va de acuerdo con lo que los directores Joe y Anthony Russohabían insinuado de la duración de la película. En noviembre,

View On WordPress

summary: BET if Tony dies in end game it’s gonna be a call back to the infamous ‘you’re not the one to make the sacrifice play’ scene in...

blog.name: artemisegeria
blog.title: This Is Not The Endgame
blog.description: Unapologetic Vision and Wanda Maximoff Stan

title: Endgame Predictions
body:
With one month left to go, 91.67% of the waiting between IW and Endgame done, and two trailers and a TV spot released, I do not think we will be getting much more information, which is appropriate for a movie like Endgame. I am going to try to keep myself from anything else until I see the movie.

I’ve posted about what I want to happen and what I don’t want to happen. Now, I am ready to make some predictions about what I think will happen. I am not that confident about many of these, and a lot of them are based on nothing more than a vague feeling. But we’ll see what happens.

1.      There is no time travel, aside from maybe whatever Scott does to get out of the quantum realm. The early leaked set photos that looked like they were from the Battle of New York were all BARF technology, dream sequences, illusions, alternate universes, etc.

2.      They do explore multiple realities/universes.

3.      The dusted people are not in the Soul Stone. I know this is one of the most popular fan theories, and I really like it myself, but I just don’t think it’s actually the case. I saw a theory, I forget where, might have been a Screen Rant video, that posited that the dusted people ended up in an alternate reality, where the half that survived in the main universe were the ones dusted. When I first heard it, I didn’t find it that plausible, but the more I think about, the more I think it has merit.

4.      Tony survives and gets to marry Pepper and have a kid and a farm. RDJ has been so central to the MCU that I don’t think they will kill him off.

5.      Steve survives, too. With everyone debating whether Steve or Tony or both will die, I think they might go for a surprise and kill off neither of them, making the death(s) someone(s) more unexpected.

6.      I think at least one major or semi-major character will die and stay dead. At this point, I have no idea who.

7.      The MCU going forward is in a totally new universe/continuity. The more I think about the possibility of the multiverse, the more I think they might pull a Star Trek (2009) and have the fix involve creating a new timeline, therefore making permanent changes and definitively forging a fresh trail.

8.      I hate to say it, but I think we will get some variation of White Vision. Prove me wrong, Marvel. I do not want to be right about this, but I just have a feeling. This would not be the absolute worst outcome because it could still be fixed, but I really, really hope I am wrong.

9.      They will fight Thanos more than once. Ever since the second trailer, I’ve seen multiple people theorizing that the Avengers and allies will try to fight Thanos once early in the movie, without their full team/strength, and get defeated again. Then, the time jump happens, and they regroup and return to fight him again for the climactic final battle. I’m not sure why, but this seems plausible to me.

10.  Shuri is fine. The picture of her on the missing people board in the first trailer was either a misleading shot or at that point in the movie, the Avengers genuinely thought she was dusted. She will help them defeat Thanos.

11.  There will be a time jump. Despite the admission that misleading footage was used in the trailers, I think certain appearance changes in the characters point in only one direction. Individual shots may be misleading, but I think the general sense that a lot of time passes at one point will remain.

12.  The Snap will still be reversed, but the fix will not involve undoing it entirely. Instead, people will be brought back to after the time jump has occurred. I just cannot fathom Marvel not bringing back half the universe’s population. But if the time jump remains intact, that will provide some permanent changes and losses.

summary: Avengers: Endgame, Fandango e AMC confermano la durata di 3 ore?
title: Avengers: Endgame, Fandango e AMC confermano la durata di 3 ore?
body:
Avengers: Endgame, Fandango e AMC confermano la durata di 3 ore?

Con Captain Marvel alle spalle e Avengers: Endgame ormai a poco più di un mese dall’arrivare nelle nostre sale cinematografiche, molte sono le discussioni su quanto durerà il film, e dopo una miriade di speculazione su se possa o meno durare davvero 3 ore, oggi vi riportiamo alcuni dati – ovviamente che non danno conferma ufficiale – che lasciano intendere una risposta affermativa.

Stando ad un…

summary: AMC Theaters Now Listing Avengers: Endgame Run Time as 3 Hours, 2 Minutes
title: AMC Theaters Now Listing Avengers: Endgame Run Time as 3 Hours, 2 Minutes
body:
AMC Theaters Now Listing #AvengersEndgame Run Time as 3 Hours, 2 Minutes

Those people who obsess over a movie run time may want to take a look at what AMC Theaters has just posted on their website. Previously, Avengers: Endgame didn’t have a run time or the official synopsis listed, but that changed this morning.

Today AMC Theaters has updated their website to not only list the official synopsis for Avengers: Endgame, but they list the run time as 3 hours, 2 minutes.…

summary: New Images Of Marvel Legends Avengers Thanos BAF Wave
title: New Images Of Marvel Legends Avengers Thanos BAF Wave
body:
New Images Of Marvel Legends Avengers Thanos BAF Wave

Hasbro has shared the official press photos of the upcoming Avengers 2019 Marvel Legends Assortment which features a Thanos build-a-figure. Shown are:

  • Avengers: Endgame – Captain America
  • Avengers: Endgame – Ronin
  • Avengers: Infinity War – Ebony Maw
  • Marvel Comics – Living Laser
  • Marvel Comics – Citizen V
  • Marvel Comics – Hercules
  • Marvel Comics – Nighthawk
  • Avengers: Endgame – Thanos Build-A-Figure

Happy…

excerpt: Marvel’s much anticipated upcoming film ‘Avengers: Endgame’ is going to be all the more special for the Indian marvelites out there, as the film will feature an all-new song composed by Indian music maestro AR Rahman.

summary:
Loki: Have any of you seen Yon-Rogg?
Carol: I have. He was staring through the window when it started to rain.
Carol: If it gets...
body:
Loki: Have any of you seen Yon-Rogg?

Carol: I have. He was staring through the window when it started to rain.

Carol: If it gets any worse we probably should let him in.

Loki: :)

Carol: :)

Loki: Have any of you seen Yon-Rogg?

Carol: I have. He was staring through the window when it started to rain.

Carol: If it gets any worse we probably should let him in.

Loki: :)

Carol: :)

summary: It’s really interesting to me how much significance has been placed on The Benatar in the two Endgame promotional posters and...
body:
It’s really interesting to me how much significance has been placed on The Benatar in the two Endgame promotional posters and the trailer:

Why so much emphasis on The Benatar floating in space? Enough to depict it in two of the major theatrical posters and prominently in the trailer? 

As this twitter thread by @biggreenasshole pointed out, the silhouette of The Benatar is reminiscent of the symbolic swallow many sailors have tattooed on their bodies: 

Here’s what one tattoo article stated about the popularity of this symbol: 

“The historic designs of swallow tattoos goes back hundreds of years and begins with the plight of sailors. When a crew was sailing a long distance on the ocean, typically 5,000 nautical miles or across the equator, the travels were often full of hardship, sickness, starvation, and quite commonly, death. One sign that their travels were nearing an end was the appearance of swallows. Because these birds never traveled far out to sea, their sighting meant that land was near and the long voyage was coming to an end. This fact led many sailors to start adopting swallow tattoo designs as a symbol of hope and a successful finish to a long journey. As a followup to this story, having a tattoo depicting 2 swallows indicated going on a very long journey (10,000 nautical miles or more) and a swallow tattoo with a dagger through its heart symbolized a memorial for a friend lost at sea.

“[…] As time passed, swallow tattoos have come to symbolize different meanings to different people. Some see the swallow art as a symbol of success or triumph. Others decide to get swallow bird tattoos to signify the return home after a long departure, such as a soldier coming back from war. Another popular meaning is that of freedom, as some people released from prison have chosen this bird tattoo as a sign of their entrance back into society. Yet another interpretation is for an everlasting love and loyalty, related to the fact that swallows mate for life.”

It’s very possible this image could be to evoke the ending of a journey. After all, this film is wrapping up what Feige calls The Infinity Saga, which has been ongoing since 2008. 

… But I think it’s worth noting the imagery is thematically tied to Tony’s arc. Tony is the one in the trailer who says, “Part of the journey is the end,” and lamenting the fact he fears he won’t be able to return home to Pepper. 

I think that’s in line with Tony’s similarities to the hero Odysseus (from The Odyssey). 

“You’re a hard man, Odysseus, stronger than other men, and you never wear out, a real iron-man” - Eurylochus (The Odyssey)

I’ve discussed this before, but the two characters (Tony and Odysseus) share a lot in common. Both came from a wealthy upbringing. Both were “good with the ladies.” Both are characterized by extreme wit and intelligence. Both were trapped in a cave and had to use their craftiness to escape. Both were extremely arrogant at the beginning of their stories only to become humble by the end. Both long for returning home–to their ride-or-die partners (Pepper and Penelope).

For this reason, it seems significant to me that Tony says in the trailer, “God, it seems like a thousand years ago. I fought my way out of that cave. Became Iron Man. Realized I loved you.” It’s summarizing the journey Tony has been on for the past decade (the same length of time Odysseus was away from home–ten long years). Tony evokes moments of his journey, musing over how far he has come, and he even emphasizes how his journey began in a cave (not dissimilar to when Odysseus tricked Polyphemus, which was the catalyst for Poseidon doing everything in his power to thwart Odysseus’s path). 

Ultimately, Odysseus returned home to Penelope. I am hopeful that all this imagery (The Benatar evoking the sailors’ swallow; The Odyssey parallels) indicates Tony will, likewise, return home to Pepper.

summary: Avengers: Endgame Spoiler About Hulk and Bruce Banner
title: Avengers: Endgame Spoiler About Hulk and Bruce Banner
body:
Avengers: Endgame Spoiler About Hulk and Bruce Banner

Over the span of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Bruce Banner has battled with the repressed monster tormented by anger.From The Incredible Hulk, to The Avengers, to Thor: Ragnarok, we’ve seen these issues gone to the bleeding edge.

It would seem that those issues will arrive at an end in Avengers: Endgame. A fresh out of the plastic new bit of stock for an activity figure with the Hulk may…

View On WordPress
